title: Ticket #6695: condor_transfer_data writes user log to wrong directory
description:
When a job with a user log is submitted with the -spool option, the user log is written in the spool directory. When condor_transfer_data is called, the user log is transferred along with the job's output files back to the client. The user log always written in the job's initialdir, even if another directory is specified in the submit file (and resulting job ad). This is wrong and needs to be fixed.

The proper behavior can be obtained by adding a file transfer remap, like so: 

transfer_output_remaps = "job.log=/data/me/job.log"

A bugfix could do that same thing. We already add remaps for stdout and stderr when spooling.
remarks:
2018-Jun-07 16:33:53 by coatsworth:
CODE REVIEW

  • You don't error check if Ad->LookupString(ATTR_JOB_IWD, full_name) sets values correctly. Is it safe to assume at this point in the FileTransfer dance that if this isn't set, something would have already blown up? If not then add a check here.
  • I feel like using the same string object (remap_fname) for different Ad->LookupString() requests is confusing, would rather see a different object for IWD lookup.

2018-Jun-14 16:21:24 by jfrey:
FileTransfer::SimpleInit() will fail if ATTR_JOB_IWD is missing from the job ad and assumes it will be an absolute path. Thus I think the assumption in InitDownloadFilenameRemaps() is fine.

I'll add a new string variable for the user log filename.

2018-Jul-30 12:22:00 by coatsworth:
CODE REVIEW

Looks good to me.
